sn12.47:1: At Sāvatthī. Then the brahmin Jaṇussoṇi approached the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him. When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side and said to him:[n.27] A brahmin Jaṇussoṇi is mentioned atSN45.4and elsewhere in the Nikāyas.Spksays that he was a great chaplain(mahāpurohita)of much wealth who had gained his name by reason of his position. On the theme of this sutta seeSN2.5.
sn12.47:2: "How is it, Master Gotama: does all exist?" "‘All exists’: this, brahmin, is one extreme."
sn12.47:3: "Then, Master Gotama, does all not exist?"
sn12.47:4: When this was said, the brahmin Jaṇussoṇi said to the Blessed One:sn.ii.77"Magnificent, Master Gotama! … From today let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life."
